original: Sven Fredrik, distriktsveterinär, Uddevalla, f. 17/8/94 i Skara av Sven Aug. W. o. Fredrika Sahlén. G. 28 m. Anna-Lisa Bjurström. Barn: Sven-Einar ’f. 29, Kerstin 31, Göran 35, In|grid 42. — Stud:ex. i Skara 15, ve-ter:ex. 23. Bat :veter. i Fältveter :kår. res. 25. Distr :veter. i Loos 27, Röksberg 28, Uddevalla :fr. 29, export- o. importbes :veter. , Gustaf Pontus, fd. rektor, Göteborg, f. 18/6/77 i Valla, Gbgs o. Bob. 1. G. 16 m. Saga Btablad. Barn: Hans f. 17, civ :ekon., kamrer, Gbg, Bo 19, fil. mag.. Forsa. — Mog:ex. i Jönkö>p. 97, teoil. fil. ex. i Upps.. 98^ dim:ex. 02, teol. lic. 10, provår v. Norra real i Sthlm 10-11. Lår. v. A. Sandströms h. lär:nesem. 09-12, v. Pe-dag. sk. i Upps. ll-lS’, extralär. v. Upps. h. at. 1. saimma tid, adj. i Gävle 1B\ vik. lektor v. h. lår:nesem. 14, adj. v. Gbgs foilksk :sem. 14, lektor där 18, lär. v. Gbgs kvinnl. ’folksk :sem. 15-24, rektor v. folksk :sem. i Linköp. 24-29, i Gbg 30-43. Tf. undervisn:råd 28-30, led. av styr. f. stat. uppfostr :anst. å Bona sed. 27, insp. v. Gbgs ensk. gymn. f. bliv. präster 30-44, ordf. i styr. f. Sigrid Rudebecks sk. o. studiehemmet Nordgården sed. 311, styr :ordf. i S v. sem:lår :’fören. 32-41, i sällsk. f. bild. av småbarnssk. sed. 38, andre ordf. i Sv:es kyrkl. lär:!förb. sed. 41, v. ordf. i Alllm. sv. fören. f. vårdien av sinnes slöa 43-46, ordf. sed. 46, insp. v. folksk :siem. i Gbg sed. 43, stud :rek-tor v. Gbgs förskolesem. sed. 44, fd. granskn :man f. bestämm. av lärob. i kristend., sekr. i Kyrkohist. fören., Smål. nat. i Upps. förste kur. m. m. Skr.: Striden om konfessio-nslös eller konfessionell relig :undervisn. (19), Om illärarutbilidn. v. våra folksk :sem. (32), Lärarkallets inverkan på låraren (331), Skolau o. den relig.-sedliga fostran (3(5) m. m., medarb. i Sv. biogr. lex., Skola o. samhälle. KN02kl, RDDO.
translated: Sven Fredrik, district veterinarian, Uddevalla, b. 17/8/94 in Skara to Sven Aug. W. and Fredrika Sahlén. Married for 28 years to Anna-Lisa Bjurström. Children: Sven-Einar, b. 29, Kerstin, b. 31, Göran, b. 35, Ingrid, b. 42. Education: graduated in Skara in 1915, veterinary examination in 1923. Served as a veterinary officer in the Field Veterinary Corps, resigned in 1925. District veterinarian in Loos in 1927, Röksberg in 1928, Uddevalla from 1929, specializing in export and import inspections. Gustaf Pontus, former headmaster, Gothenburg, b. 18/6/77 in Valla, Gothenburg and Bohus County. Married for 16 years to Saga Bladtablad. Children: Hans, b. 17, economist, treasurer, Gothenburg, Bo, b. 19, Master of Arts, Forsa. Education: A + B exams in Jönköping in 1897, theology and philosophy exams in Uppsala in 1898, teaching degree in 1902, theological licentiate in 1910, probationary year at Norra Real in Stockholm from 1910-1911. Taught at A. Sandström's teacher training seminar from 1909-1912, Uppsala Pedagogical School from 1911-1915, Uppsala upper secondary school as a substitute teacher at the same time, assistant in Gävle in 1919, temporary lecturer at the Teacher Training Seminar in Gothenburg in 1914, assistant at the Gothenburg School of Public Education from 1914, lecturer there from 1918, teaching at the Gothenburg Women's School of Public Education from 1915-1924, headmaster of the School of Public Education in Linköping from 1924-1929, in Gothenburg from 1930-1943. Acting Education Councilor from 1928-1930, member of the board for the governmental educational institution at Bona since 1927, inspector of the Gothenburg Private Gymnasium for prospective priests from 1930-1944, chairman of the board for Sigrid Rudebeck's School and Study Home since 1931, chairman of the Swedish Teachers' Association since 1932, in the Society for the Promotion of Child Education since 1938, deputy chairman of the Swedish Church Teachers' Association since 1941, vice chairman of the Swedish Association for the Care of the Mentally Disabled from 1943-1946, chairman since 1946, inspector of the School of Public Education in Gothenburg since 1943, studying director of the Gothenburg Preschool Teacher Training Seminar since 1944, former examiner for the determination of curriculum in Christianity, secretary of the Church History Association, member of the Småland National Committee in Uppsala, first course, etc. Published works: The Struggle for Non-denominational or Confessional Religious Education (1919), The Teacher Training of Our School of Public Education (1932), The Influence of the Teaching Vocation on the Teacher (1931), School and Religious-Moral Education (1935), and more. Collaborator in the Swedish Biographical Dictionary, School and Society. Knight of the Order of the North Star, Royal Swedish Order of the Polar Star.
